many excellent workman throughly finished til dayes augustus almost yeares since first attempt roofed strengthned made principall house monarchicall citty florus old incolae exceeding valiant resolute prisoner fell downe foot kissed told oft heard father lettered say spaine bee conquered people whose generall haue mole right shoulder one hand longer hee animate souldiers next encounter vncloathed compasse mile length bredth fruitfullest part countrey conimbra people hereof plaine simple behauiour rest spaine beleeue proue biall speech none wisest whereas spaniard said seeme wise fooles french seeme fooles wise italian seeme wise portugalls affirmed neither wise much seeme much different spaniard haue proverbe telleth v portugalls pocos locos foolish haue naturall antipathy spaniard ocean vpon standeth amiens hath head quintins diuideth picardie toy hauing receaued eight lesser streames looseth selfe sea loyre seated nantes orleance riseth mountaines avergue greatest france hauing runne mile augmented channell entertainement lesser rivulet mingleth sweet water brackish aquitane ocean rhoane springing driga three mile head rhene watreth lyon receaueth sone hastning richest rhoane swiftest garond greatest loyre sweetest fruitfull region may thinke giue credence report first peopled samothes sixt sonne iophet called scripture mesech yeare world ofspring attributed certainely warlike nation without whose loue king could secure himselfe imminent danger sparing diet vsed fine one outgrewe girdle men roman fought rather owne preservation hope conquest enlarge dominion yet last vndertooke warre till subiected almost residue world also much valour roman though war managed able captaine euer rome gaue breath diuisions plutarch brought vnder men formerly vnder conduct bremus said brother inus king england discom ited roman riuer allia sacked citty beseiged capitoll anno vc cause terrified roman expulsion rome camillus law made priest though al time exempted without mature consideration bin headily receiued church france belgia people banished bishop seeing calvin two fellowministers vsurpe prerogatiue though title bishop banished three desiring recall againe content receiue discipline ouerprejudiciall city calvin framed consisting two layman annually chosen euery one minister also much grumbling receiued city diuided betwixt bishop savoyen till last bishop got entire possession leauing duke soueraignty homage whose name lawes made mony coyned people hauing banished bishop haue stood since owne liberty aided england venice crownes florence intelligence resisted great siege savoy anno allow manner honest recreation vpon sunday fornication punish nine dayes fasting adultery death haue law malefactour flie refuge punish custome place crime mountaines full neat ho e belonging gentrie prouince fortified strong castle outworkes though yet fully recovered damage receiued taken henry warres duke anno tarantaise commandeth passage nto italy commonwealth sustaineth lesse losse entertaining forraine prince generall warres ended presently discard course avoid faction seruitude like happen imploy seruice people vertue courage might perchance head world italy face europe venice eye italy fairest strongest actiue part powerfull body seemeth subversion last monarchie romane genius made pythagoricall transmigration venice whose peace hath procured plenty whose warres peace christendome animated vertues old rome coniecture aright knit constant temper present rome carkasse old retaineth nothing ruines cause sin thus much citty chiefe italy resigned empire brother ferdinand landecke tirol b lzan trent riuer adesis councell held pope paul third began yeare doctrine luther calvin councell continued sometimes assembled sometimes dissolued space yeares first meeting diuerse place bin intimated dashed furthered hindred others yeares together effect councell cannot better describe word history hereof councell desired procured godly men revnite church began diuided hath established schisme made party obstinate dis ords irreconcileable managed prince reformation ecclesiasticall discipline hath caused greatest deformation euer since christianitie beginne hoped bishop regaine episcopall authority part vsurped pope ath made loose altogether bringing greater seruitude contrary scared avoided see rome potent meanes moderate exorbitant power thereof mounted small beginning diuerse degree vnlimited excesse hath established confirmed ouer part remaineth subiect vnto neuer great soundly rooted farre word history prouinces belong house austria revenue prince would certainly farre greater neighbourhood turke put continuall expences losse men money howsoeuer think may yeeld yearely two million crownes vpwards armes archduke gules fesse argent armes assumed marquesse leopold siege acon whole armour couered ouer blood belt remained white whereas former armes azu e six larkes armes supposed haue bin assumed first marquess austria possessed six petit prouinces tenth legion called ala da ancient time station bohemia bara kingdome bohemia containeth bohemia dukedome silesia marquisates lusatia morauia bohemia environed hercynian forrest roman could long time penetrate hath east silesia moravia west franconia north misuia lusatia ortelius south bavaria ortelius whole kingdome containeth circuit mile compasse comprehended city walled townes castle village inhabited people giuen drink gluttony also valour loue honour last quality belonging noble better sort people former common moderate fashion german rich poore noble base vse sclavonian language mountaig chief bohemian captain euer read zisca battailes fought defence hussite pope confoderats preuailed went away victorious insomuch death willed bohemian flea make drumme skinne perswading could neuer ouercome wherein hee concei ed himselfe scipio africanus vortimer king brittaines selues one hauing almost ruined commonwealth carthage commanded body buried tombe might looke toward africke hauing expulsed saxon brittanie desired interred hauen towne stonar tanet vsuall landingplace people thinking thereby affright carthaginian italy saxon brittaine christian religion first preached country one bosinous anno thereabouts since time haue continued though without admixture one notable vanity one picardus comming lowcountries drew great sort men woman vnto munster pretending bring state perfection adam fall whence called picards adamites respect vnto marriage yet could accompany woman vntil man comming adam said vnto father adam enflamed towards woman adam made answere increase multiply liued island called parad se went starke naked continued long zisca hearing entred fooles paradise put sword ao time also workes wickliffe brought bohemia certain scholler beene student vniuersity oxford happening hand iohn husse hierome prague two men whereof country may worthily boast wrought heart desire reforme church businesse prosecuted earnestly summoned councell constance condemned hereticks burned anno yet doctrine deep root bohemian could neuer warre persecution plucked vp day continueth though abundantly perfected writing luther calvin painful labourer god haruest soyle exceeding fruitfull enriched mine sort camden except gold tinne haue good plenty mine whereof first found cornishman banished england onely cloathes people house lined thicke furres every gentleman man note hath dwelling house stoue hothouse keepe thaw themselues trauell way vse often rub nose eares snowe ice settle recall motiue incongruously faine two men somewhat distant talke together winter word frozen cannot bee heard party spring returne place word melt order frozen spoken bee plainely vnderstood winter neither summer lesse miraculous huge sea ice manner couered whole surface countrey first approach sunne suddainly dissolued water quickly dryed vp earth dressed holyday apparell mature growth fruit flourishing liues good subiects mahomet turkish bashaw wont say master muscovite absolute prince world revenewes mony houshold charge defrayed amount million rubble apparelled like king bishop wearing royall vestiment miter crosier staffe sitteth state plate house set great number grauest seemliest men musco adioyning citties richly apparelled wardrope archb ab forreiners knowing cunning fraud appeare many prince noble men small cause admiration wonder magnificence country may bee rightly called mother river chiefe tanais ancient geographer thought bee onely bound twixt europe asia disburdeneth selfe palus maeotis duina entreth scythian sea abbie st nicholas english since discouery northerne passage vse land disperse themselues part vast empire truly nation kindly entertained amongst russian prince people english haue many immunity granted nation cause cannot attribute neuerdying fame late queene admired loued barbarian also conformable behauiour english generall accepted wasiliwich basiliades nayld hat forraine embassadour head peremptorinesse hee time vsed thomas smith curtesie immaginable another time iesuite possevinus archb ab began exhort accept romish faith vpon emperours germanie imes turke sometimes polander moldavia belongeth little country bessarabia maginus lying betweene mount hoemus south lituania north seated commodiously blacke sea called bessi ancient inhabitant place progenitours ofnians made turkish province chiefe townes kilim chermen moncastrum seat turkish sanziacke built riuer tira farre influxe sea walachia walachia called properly flaccia flaccus roman planted italian roman colonie seated betweene transilvan danubius people speake latin tongue much corrupted hardly vnderstood chiefe citties sabinium prailaba tergovista mereasor vaivods se countrey abundant thing necessary life vse man mine gold siluer iron saltpits wine cattle especially horse number lesse great good yeeldeth also pure refined kinde brimstone make excellent sarma ians entred country ouerthrew set battle carried great booty among thing mare breed mare tooke battaile custome scythian sarmatians vse mare onely warres stopping midst race pisse could impediment flight returne homeward triballi deny passage country vn esse might pertake spoyles denied fall word blowes next pitched field fight philip wounded arrow passing thigh nayled saddle horse gauled wound fell downe ground macedonian seeing fall supposing hee slaine fled field leauing sarmatian spoyles traballi whose receauers seeme haue beene chiefe citties stonibourg seat despot rascia lieth betweene servia bulgaria chief citty boden famous annuall fayres two province subiect seueral despot turk hist vnder whose command long inioyed tranquillity til anno george despot servia rascia became tributary amurath second death george christian profession turke affection action life liuely demonstrate sonne lazarus succeeded dead mahomet great vnited province empire anno bvlgaria athenian iland salami crushed one fatall ouerthrow law enacted athens whosoeuer mentioned recouery salami loose life solon compelled fain himselfe mad safelier motion matter prosperous end fortune megarenses lasted long eminent degree yet continued free people till comming macedonian second town note megaris eleusis vvhere cere temple vvhich hence called cere eleusina boeotia hath east attica west phocis north riuer cephisus south megaris sea took name b vvhich signifieth oxe vvhen cadmus vveary vvith seeking sister eur pa vvhom iupiter stolne phoenicia came delphos hee vvas vvarned oracle germany working sea purged amongst high estimation celebrated name la bonne beere anglet rre old drink england ale commeth danish word oela questionlesse selfe without commixture accused vse wholsome drinke howeuer pleased poet time henry third thus descant nescio uod monstrum stygiae conforme paludi ceruisiam pleri que vocant nil spissius illa cum bibitur nil clarius est dum mingitur vnde constat qu mulias faeces ventre relinquit strange drink like stygian lake men call ale knowe make folke drinke thicke vent passing thinne much dregges therefore must need remaine within neither quite omit bell haue many ring tunable well guided make excellent melody haue heard forrainers call country ranging iland tradition old writer england bred wolues neither would liue report consentaneous truth store till edgar k england impo ed idwallo prince wale yearely tribute wolues meanes quite rooted ayre country temperate neither hot france spaine summer northernly situation cold winter ayre kingdome daughter must need name iland scotia honour fopperies confutation doubtlesly first inhabitant iland came brittaine brittaine ighest country vnto speedy wastage hither secondly ancient writer call iland brittish iland thirdly tacitus giueth v country verdict solum coelum que cultus ingenia homi um ha multum britannia differunt habit disposition people much vnlike brittaines people generally strong nimble body haughtie heart carelesse liues patient cold hunger implacable enmity constant loue light beliefe greedy glory word bad shall nowhere finde worse good shall hardly meet better particularly men woman within pal place english discipline heartily embraced conformable ciuility kernes name call wilde irish extreamely barbarous behauing themselues christian scarcely men vse irish language spoken also west scotland hebrides westerne ilands receiued christian faith preaching patricke anno present ciuill sort follow reformation according church england kernes either adhere pope superstitious fancy soyle selfe abundantly fruitfull may seen place industry man playeth midwife earth helping bring forth contrary agriculture laborious manuring ground deficient also fruit earth cannot abundant famous hath country bin former time piety religious liues monkes amongst cannot remember columban memorable apothegme offered many faire preferment leaue country replyed becommeth embrace men rich christ sake forsaken owne sooner find pietie amongst cannibal america kernes ireland amongst prerogatiues iland one breedeth venemous serpent neither liue brought region hence selfe greekes call hibernia ecold securd god nature feare gift giuen crete ioves mother deare poisonous snake neuer bred dare hisse hurtfull venome shed miraculous thing ireland breed except woman mahometans arabia deserta place people israel wand ed yeares long vnder command moyses fed manna heauen water dryest rock soile neither fit herbage tillage couered ouer dry thick sand sandy desarts sea arabia ship camel beast content little sustenance vsually carrying waight sometimes thousand inhabitant region citties chiefe whereof bassora arabia petrosa called either rocky petra chief town called rathalalah second town note aresh arissa consisting house royall castle garrisond hundred souldiers ezion geber coast red sea solomon navy kept station put saile towards ophir returned thence country barren desolate bearing neither grasse tree palme excepted good store dromedary hath beast swiftnes easily carry man mile day also good store ostrich returne petra find haue bin straightly besieged seuerus traian like successe roman skirmish assault alwayes put worst traia e escape free compelled cast away imperiall habite flye life next man vnto slain dart nay may credit dion neuer sparing like prodigy heauens fought roman thunder lightning whirlewinds tempest often made battery city country containeth region nabathaeae agara whereof first somtimes vsed arabia ovid eurus ad auroram nabathaea que regna recessit eurus vnto east flye blest arabia doth lye possessed saracen hagarens descended abraham hagar also dwelt emmins zanzummims cast amorites moabites also dwelt medus yeares raigne slaine cyrus king persian leaue worthy man cannot hold good lord prophet ieremie pronounced chap nation serue nabucadnezzar sonne sonnes sonne whereas nabonnedus prince strange bloud nation serue balthassar sonnes sonne nabuchadnezzar oracle finished let v examine argument withall scoffes prodigally bestoweth maintaine contrary opinion natio chronologorum whole rout chronologers boni diligentes viri good simple meaning men addunt alia nihilo veriora first complement vt igitur quod chronologorum est omnes resipiscant c therefore may repent euer chronologers bringeth berosus cited iosephus first booke appion berosus maketh nabonnedus saith kingdome balthassar people deliuered babylonian scaliger would haue say noble man medes neither authority berosus countervaile daniel chapter telleth balthassar kingdome divided among medes persian argument drawne nature word nonlatin alphabet chapter darius mede tooke empire word tooke implied forcible inuasion hand caliph proper sultan ao gempsas soldan countrie recouered reputation parthian subduing persian haue told together persia subiect sophios thus much parthia tartaria maginus tartaria bounded east easterne ocean west muscouie moldauia north scythicke frozen ocean south mare caspium hill taurus wall china country extendeth selfe east west mile north south mile country old knowne name scythia whose inhabitant posterity magog son iaphet called first magogins afterward scythe scythus first king seuerall inhabitant first essedones men reioyced parent death whose head trimly wrought rounded gold vsed make carowsing cup agathyrsi vsed paint themselues euery one noble deformed stained cause haue conceited pictes haue drawne originall hence nomades house vsed abide longest fodder cattle best consumed departed axiacae valiant withall barbarous inhumane vsing warres drinke blood first slewe euen distilled wound geloni vsed apparell themselues skinnes enimies head horse skinne body iust like scythian nomades tartarian hords euident argument descent originall sp iards since comming hither haue behaued themselues inhumanely towards vnarmed natiues killing vp like sheepe slaughter forcing like beast labour mine carry burden doe al drudgery haythney nobleman many applausiue argument perswaded embrace christian religion demanded first place ordained baptized answere made heauen ioyes secondly place bequeathed would bee baptized answere made hell torment thirdly place allotted spaniard answere made heauen hee renounced intended baptisme protesting rather goe hell vnbaptized liue heauen cruell people rest driuen font like many horse watringplace receiued church chr st thick threefold insomuch one old frier himselfe confessed charles fift sprinkled water baptisme another carthaginian colonie tyre perfect art thereby much damaged roman till hapned tempest separating quinqueremis galley fiue oares carthaginian fleet cast shoare italy whereby roman learning art made mony pastboard hapneth case necessity two mettals gold siluer hauing many hundred yeares though abundance beene principall instrument exchange bartery questionlesse continue end world sr thomas moore second booke vtopia preferreth iron mettals vt sine quo non magi quam sine gne que aqua vi ere mortales queant giueth v also plot bring gold siluer contempt telling v vtopians imploy mettals deuice would sort people lucian fableth moone knowe though perhaps might fit well enough sure blunary world neuer like take leaue telling many thought extraordinary plenty gold siluer since discouery country cause dearth al thing respect former time much much may giue yet want adde also cause high prize day viz monopoly combination merchant craftsman transportation graine pleasure great personage excesse priuate men like last rather take concauses first indeed principall excellent sr henry sauill hath end note tacitus excessiue abundance nonlatin alphabet thing consist meerely constitution men draweth necessarily nonlatin alphabet thing nature requireth higher rate market capta ab augusto alexandria saith orosius rom tantum pibus eius creuit vt duplo maiora quam antebac rerum venalium pr tia statuerentur question whether two kingdomes happier supplieth selfe mony trafficke workes art supplied mine growing gift nature finde tale part resolued two marchants departing spaine get gold touched vpon part barbary one buyeth moore dig delue fraughteth vessell sheep come indie one finding mine set slaues worke hapning grassie ground put sheep grasing slaues grow cold hungry call food cloathing sheepmaster increase cattle abundance one got gold toyle charge hazard gladly gaue vnto continuall supply victualls rayments himselfe seruants end mine exhausted gold thence arising exchanged sheepheards necessary nature required home returneth sheepheard triumph companion hauing nothing shew improuement stocke dare determine question weighty tell hollander english benefit
